pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:5.1: 10. The training rule on dancing and singing
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:6.2: At that time in Rājagaha there was a hilltop festival,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:6.3: and the nuns from the group of six went to see it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:6.5: “How can nuns go to see dancing, singing, and music? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six go to see dancing, singing, and music?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six go to see dancing, singing, and music?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:8.1: ‘If a nun goes to see dancing or singing or music, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:11.1: If she is on her way to see it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:11.2: Wherever she stands to see it or hear it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:11.3: Every time she moves outside the range of sight and then sees it or hears it again, she commits an offense entailing confession.
